primitives
Class GraphicPrimitive

java.lang.Object
  primitives.GraphicPrimitive
Direct Known Subclasses:
PrimitiveAdvText, PrimitiveBezier, PrimitiveConnection, PrimitiveLine, PrimitiveMacro, PrimitiveOval, PrimitivePCBLine, PrimitivePCBPad, PrimitivePolygon, PrimitiveRectangle
public abstract class GraphicPrimitive
extends java.lang.Object

getFirstPoint

public java.awt.Point getFirstPoint()
Get the first control point of the primitive

movePrimitive

public void movePrimitive(int dx,
                          int dy)
Move the primitive.

Parameters:
dx - the relative x displacement (logical units)
dy - the relative y displacement (logical units)

mirrorPrimitive

public void mirrorPrimitive(int xPos)
Mirror the primitive. Adapted from Lorenzo Lutti's original code.

Parameters:
xPos - is the symmetry axis

rotatePrimitive

public void rotatePrimitive(boolean bCounterClockWise,
                            int ix,
                            int iy)
Rotate the primitive. Adapted from Lorenzo Lutti's original code.

Parameters:
bCounterClockWise - specify if the rotation should be done counterclockwise.
ix - the x coordinate of the center of rotation
iy - the y coordinate of the center of rotation

setSelected

public void setSelected(boolean s)
Set the primitive as selected.

Parameters:
s - the new state

getSelected

public boolean getSelected()
Get the selection state of the primitive.

Returns:
true if the primitive is selected, false otherwise.

getLayer

public final int getLayer()
Get the layer of the current primitive.

Returns:
the layer number.

parseLayer

public void parseLayer(java.lang.String token)

setLayer

public void setLayer(int l)
Set the layer of the current primitive. A quick check is done.

Parameters:
l - the desired layer.

selectLayer

protected final boolean selectLayer(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                    java.util.Vector layerV)
Treat the current layer. In particular, select the corresponding color in the actual graphic context. If the primitive is selected, select the corrisponding color.

Parameters:
g - the graphic context used for the drawing.
layerV - a LayerDesc vector with the descriptions of the layers being used.

drawHandles

public void drawHandles(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                        MapCoordinates cs)
Draw the handles for the current primitive.

Parameters:
g - the graphic context to be used.
cs - the coordinate mapping used.

onHandle

public int onHandle(MapCoordinates cs,
                    int px,
                    int py)
Tells if the pointer is on an handle.

Parameters:
cs - the coordinate mapping used.
px - the x (screen) coordinate of the pointer.
py - the y (screen) coordinate of the pointer.
Returns:
NO_DRAG if the pointer is not on an handle, or the index of the handle selected.

selectRect

public boolean selectRect(int px,
                          int py,
                          int w,
                          int h)
Select the primitive if one of its virtual point is in the specified rectangular region (given in logical coordinates).

Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the top left point.
py - the y coordinate of the top left point.
w - the width of the region
h - the height of the region
Returns:
true if at least a primitive has been selected

drawFast

public void drawFast(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                     MapCoordinates coordSys,
                     java.util.Vector LayerDesc)
Draw the graphic primitive on the given graphic context. Normally, this method calls the usual draw method. Of course, if for a given primitive (text for example) the drawing operations are too much slow, this method should be overridden in the derived class.

Parameters:
g - the graphic context in which the primitive should be drawn.
coordSys - the graphic coordinates system to be applied.
LayerDesc - the layer description.

getControls

public java.util.Vector getControls()
Get the control parameters of the given primitive. Each primitive should probably overload this version. We give here a very general implementation, allowing to change only virtual points.

Returns:
a vector of ParameterDescription containing each control parameter. The first parameters should always be the virtual points.

setControls

public void setControls(java.util.Vector v)
Set the control parameters of the given primitive. Each primitive should probably overload this version. We give here a very general implementation, allowing to change only virtual points. This method is specular to getControls().

Parameters:
v - a vector of ParameterDescription containing each control parameter. The first parameters should always be the virtual points.

draw

public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                          MapCoordinates coordSys,
                          java.util.Vector LayerDesc)
Draw the graphic primitive on the given graphic context.

Parameters:
g - the graphic context in which the primitive should be drawn.
coordSys - the graphic coordinates system to be applied.
LayerDesc - the layer description.

parseTokens

public abstract void parseTokens(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                                 int N)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Parse a token array and store the graphic data for a given primitive Obviously, that routine should be called *after* having recognized that the called primitive is correct. That routine also sets the correct layer. An IOException is thrown if there is an error.

Parameters:
tokens - the tokens to be processed. tokens[0] should be the command of the actual primitive.
N - the number of tokens present in the array
extra1 - a first extra parameter
extra2 - a second extra parameter
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getDistanceToPoint

public abstract int getDistanceToPoint(int px,
                                       int py)
Gets the distance (in primitive's coordinates space) between a given point and the primitive. When it is reasonable, the behaviour can be binary (polygons, ovals...). In other cases (lines, points), it can be proportional.

Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the given point
py - the y coordinate of the given point

getControlPointNumber

public abstract int getControlPointNumber()
Gets the number of control points used.

Returns:
the number of points used by the primitive

toString

public abstract java.lang.String toString(boolean extensions)
Obtain a string command descripion of the primitive.

Parameters:
extensions - produce a string eventually containing FidoCadJ extensions over the original FidoCad format.
Returns:
the FIDOCAD command line.

export

public abstract void export(ExportInterface exp,
                            MapCoordinates cs)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Each graphic primitive should call the appropriate exporting method of the export interface specified.

Parameters:
exp - the export interface that should be used
cs - the actual coordinate mapping
Throws:
java.io.IOException
